burlap.behavior.stochasticgames

Class GameAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.GameAnalysis

  • public class GameAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a means to record all the interactions in a stochastic game; specifically, the sequence of states, joint actions taken, and joint reward received. It also has methods to converting everything to a string/file and parsing a string/file back into this object so that results can be recorded and saved to disk.

    This class should be used either by constructing with an initial state (GameAnalysis(State)) or by constructing with the default constructor and then using the initializeGameWithInitialState(State) method before recording any further transitions. Transitions should then be recorded with the recordTransitionTo(JointAction, State, Map) method which takes as input the next state to which the agent transtions, the joint action taken in the previously recorded state that causes the transition, and the joint reward received for the transition.

    When querying about the state, joint action, or joint rewards, use the methods getState(int), getJointAction(int), and getJointReward(int) respectively. These methods take as input the time step of the element you want. Note that t = 0 refers to the initial state step so calling getState(0) and getJointAction(0) will return the initial state and the joint action taken in the initial state, respectively. However, joint rewards are always received in the next time step from the state and action that produced them. Therefore, getJointReward(0) is undefined. Instead, the first reward received will be at time step 1: getReward(1). Additionally, the action and reward for a specific agent in a specific time step can be queried with getActionForAgent(int, String) and getRewardForAgent(int, String), respectively.

    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      • getJointAction

        public JointAction getJointAction(int t)
        Returns the joint action taken in time step t where t=0 refers to the joint action taken in the initial state.
        Parameters:
        t - the time step
        Returns:
        the joint action taken in time step t

      • getJointReward

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getJointReward(int t)
        Returns the joint reward received in time step t. Note that rewards are always returned in the time step after the joint action that generated them; therefore, this method is undefined for t = 0. Instead, the first time step with a reward is t=1 which refers to the joint reward received after the first joint action is taken in the initial state.
        Parameters:
        t - the time step
        Returns:
        the joint reward received at time step t

      • getActionForAgent

        public GroundedSingleAction getActionForAgent(int t,
                                     java.lang.String agentName)
        Returns the action taken for the given agent at the given time step where t=0 refers to the joint action taken in the initial state. if there is no action taken by the agent with the given name, then a runtime exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        t - the time step
        agentName - the name of the agent
        Returns:
        the action taken by the specified agent in the given time step

      • getRewardForAgent

        public double getRewardForAgent(int t,
                       java.lang.String agentName)
        Returns the reward received for the agent with the given name at the given step. Note that rewards are always returned in the time step after the joint action that generated them; therefore, this method is undefined for t = 0. Instead, the first time step with a reward is t=1 which refers to the reward received after the first joint action is taken in the initial state.
        Parameters:
        t - the time step
        agentName - the name of the agent
        Returns:
        the reward received by the agent

      • agentIsInvolvedInGame

        public boolean agentIsInvolvedInGame(java.lang.String agentName)
        Returns true if an agent with the given name took any actions in the course of this game.
        Parameters:
        agentName - the name of the agent
        Returns:
        true if the agent took an action in this game; false otherwise.

      • numTimeSteps

        public int numTimeSteps()
        Returns the number of time steps recorded which is equal to the number of states observed.

        the number of time steps recorded.

      • maxTimeStep

        public int maxTimeStep()
        Returns the max time step index in this game which equals numTimeSteps()-1.
        Returns:
        the max time step index in this game

      • recordTransitionTo

        public void recordTransitionTo(JointAction jointAction,
                      State nextState,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> jointReward)

        Parameters:
        jointAction - the joint action taken in the last recorded state in this object
        nextState - the next state to which the agents transition
        jointReward - the joint reward received for the transiton

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String path,
               StateParser op)
        Writes this game to a file. If the the directory for the specified file path do not exist, then they will be created. If the file extension is not ".game" will automatically be added.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file in which to write this game.
        op - the state parser to use to convert state objects to string representations.

      • parseStringIntoGameAnalysis

        public static GameAnalysis parseStringIntoGameAnalysis(java.lang.String str,
                                       SGDomain domain,
                                       StateParser op)
        Parses a string representing a GameAnalysis object into an actual GameAnalysis object.
        Parameters:
        str - the string representation
        domain - the stochastic games domain to which the actions belong
        op - the state parser used to represent states
        Returns:
        a GameAnalysis object.

      • parseFileIntoGA

        public static GameAnalysis parseFileIntoGA(java.lang.String path,
                           SGDomain domain,
                           StateParser op)
        Reads a game that was written to a file and turns into a GameAnalysis object.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the game file.
        domain - the stochastic games domain to which the states and actions belong
        op - a state parser that can parse the state string representation in the file
        Returns:
        an GameAnalysis object.
